page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: {PUBLIC TRANSPORT}is limited in this rural area,and almost every household owns a vehicle.A{Postbus}runs to Hawick on six afternoons every week, and a{Community Bus}owned by the district goes to Jedburgh on a Friday, and Hawick on a Saturday.People may also fill any spaces on the two High School buses going to Hawick and Jedburgh.The drawback is,that these buses only touch one small part of the block,and are out of reach of many elderly people,although the Community Bus makes detours if requested. {PRIVATE TRANSPORT}is usually a car,although many young people have motor bikes,and Farmers of course have a very wide range of vehicles.There is also a{Haulage Firm}in the block which specialises in transporting livestock. {HORSES}are ridden for pleasure,fox- hunting,and on some hill farms.
